(1 comment)
This support was added recently and can you please explain why this is being removed?
This plugin is part of common , Not openpower specific .
My bad. I misinterpreted the scope. Corrected now. Please review.
Realized the mistake and corrected now. Please review again.
Acknowledged
Acknowledged
Kindly review
Kindly review again.
Kindly review again
duplicate?
Acknowledged
REDUNTANT_FW_VERSION
Acknowledged
split the line
Acknowledged
both line 13 and line 17 are same why can;t we put it under 1 if condition?

Actually the first line is to check if the variable is already populated or not. If not populated then only call the function (this is to avoid expensive dbus calls multiple times). Second one checks if it is already populated or freshly populated even then does it have the data?
if condition in line 13 and line 17 are same why can;t we have one if condition

Actually the first line is to check if the variable is already populated or not. If not populated then only call the function (this is to avoid expensive dbus calls multiple times). Second one checks if it is already populated or freshly populated even then does it have the data?
Plugin should independently add to or remove user. Design direction is not create to tight dependncy on plugin.

I thought as the 90% code is same for both the plugins and they are lamost related to each other thus keeping the common code in a common place would reduce the maintenance effort for future and also would be less bug prone.
Functions is used for keeping infrastructure code dreport packaging , not intened to keep the plugin back-end.

Agreed but if we don't do this then we have to replicate the same code (at least 90% of it) for both the plugins. Now in future if something changes in the common code then we have to change it in both the places (which may lead to missing out or buggy code). I can again separate the code (with duplicating the 90% common code in both the places) but that would lead to same dbus calls/ops multiple times (unnecessarily) and would definitely cost the performance of the entire operations. Kindly suggest.
kind of agree with jayanth probably we can add new functions script in the plugin area

root@rain104bmc:~# busctl --list --no-pager tree xyz.openbmc_project.Software.BMC.Updater | grep /xyz/openbmc_project/software/
/xyz/openbmc_project/software/0718fa29
/xyz/openbmc_project/software/50a2b3eb


if some other objects are created this condition will fail so better to add this
Acknowledged

# Strip the leading paths
    firmware1="${read_array[0]:3}"
    firmware2="${read_array[1]:3}"

    # Get priorities
    firmware_priority[0]=$(busctl get-property "$dbus_object" "$firmware1" "$dbus_object_priority_method" Priority | awk '{print $2}')
    firmware_priority[1]=$(busctl get-property "$dbus_object" "$firmware2" "$dbus_object_priority_method" Priority | awk '{print $2}')

    # Get versions based on priorities
    if [ "${firmware_priority[0]}" -eq 0 ]; then
        REDUNDANT_FW_VERSION=$(busctl get-property "$dbus_object" "$firmware1" "$dbus_object_version_method" Version | awk '{print $2}')
        MIN_FW_VERSION_LEVEL=$(busctl get-property "$dbus_object" "$firmware2" "$dbus_object_min_version_method" MinimumVersion | awk '{print $2}')
    else
        REDUNDANT_FW_VERSION=$(busctl get-property "$dbus_object" "$firmware2" "$dbus_object_version_method" Version | awk '{print $2}')
        MIN_FW_VERSION_LEVEL=$(busctl get-property "$dbus_object" "$firmware1" "$dbus_object_min_version_method" MinimumVersion | awk '{print $2}')
    fi

can we optimize like this
